Articles.Content: I'm new in the forum and fairly new to verbal space program so i would like good tips from heavy ksp players!

Tip 1: It's Kerbal Space Program (I jest at your typo)

Tip 2: Welcome to the community! I suggest you have fun and enjoy the explosions.

Tip 3: Don't be afraid to ask questions. We will try to answer them.

Tip 4: Don't worry about Jeb, he can take care of himself.

Tip 5: Have Fun!

Tip 6: MOAR BOOSTERS! (Not really.)

Tip 7: MOAR STRUTSSSS! (But don't overdo it!)

Tip 8: Smaller can be better!
Start simple. Tweak as needed to get the mission done. Design multistages from the top down and test each stage so it does what you want it to before adding more.

Welcome to the forums!

You'll be able to find plenty of good tips in the " What are the most important things you've learned about playing KSP to pass on?" thread in Gameplay Questions and Tutorials. I also maintain a list of tutorials at the Drawing Board, linked in my signature; many of them are specifically written for new players. Also, if you have any specific questions you want addressed, feel free to start a thread asking it in the appropriate subforum.

Hope this helps!
Welcome aboard! The advice above this post is all pretty helpful, be sure to listen up!
I've found the best thing is to start small and gradually go bigger in rocket size the bigger your missions are

Welcome to the forums! Enjoy your stay.

My tip is if you fail, try again. Through trial and error you can improve and get better.

Tip 9: Things -will- explode. be sure to take pictures/video for everyones entertainment

Tip 10: If you think your rocket(s) is/are crap, take a moment, go read this thread, and take solace that even the pros get it wrong - http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/32027-You-Will-Not-Go-To-Space-Today-Post-your-fails-here%21

Tip 4: Don't worry about Jeb, he can take care of himself.

Yep, he will laugh manically even in the face of imminent death. He loves explosions too.

Welcome carlisch.

Be carefull. I am NOT heavy.
